body:
1. this statement creates the attribute nc, it does not exist before this. We use this as a simple way to pass values to the loss function etc. by passing the model directly.

2. depends on your dataset of course.

3. multi-class is on by default during testing.

4. focal loss affects the loss. testing time depends on many factors, you may want to profile test.py to see exactly where your slowdown is.

Sure, I will try.
For the 3rd question, there is a typo. I mean `multi-scale` actually.

Last time I ask you question, I only have 0.63mAP on VOC.
Recently I have 0.835.
Love your job.
multi-scale is also on by default. If you git pull and train your training will automatically be multi-scale 320-640

I mean this:
`parser.add_argument('--multi-scale', action='store_true', help='adjust (67%% - 150%%) img_size every 10 batches')`

@ChristopherSTAN yes, its on by default. 

https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/cd5f6227d92fc92ecf6ca941b440285b3c12afd5/train.py#L69

Oh, cool, amzing.
That's my fault.
Thanks again.
This issue is stale because it has been open 30 days with no activity. Remove Stale label or comment or this will be closed in 5 days.

> Sure, I will try.
> For the 3rd question, there is a typo. I mean `multi-scale` actually.
> 
> Last time I ask you question, I only have 0.63mAP on VOC.
> Recently I have 0.835.
> Love your job.

Really cool results! Could you please share some experience on fine-tuning? 
I trained the model on VOC07train+VOC12train using pretrained backbone weights (darknet53.conv.74) and evaluate the model on VOC07val. I tried some modifications and could only have mAP about 0.7. I have no idea what to do next. 
Really looking forward to your help if possible, thanks!

> > Sure, I will try.
> > For the 3rd question, there is a typo. I mean `multi-scale` actually.
> > Last time I ask you question, I only have 0.63mAP on VOC.
> > Recently I have 0.835.
> > Love your job.
> 
> Really cool results! Could you please share some experience on fine-tuning?
> I trained the model on VOC07train+VOC12train using pretrained backbone weights (darknet53.conv.74) and evaluate the model on VOC07val. I tried some modifications and could only have mAP about 0.7. I have no idea what to do next.
> Really looking forward to your help if possible, thanks!

I think it may come from your way to split the tran/test set, I use a script from [https://github.com/AlexeyAB/darknet/blob/master/scripts/voc_label.py](url)

And bigger Batch size may help.

> > > Sure, I will try.
> > > For the 3rd question, there is a typo. I mean `multi-scale` actually.

> > Really looking forward to your help if possible, thanks!
> 
> I think it may come from your way to split the tran/test set, I use a script from [https://github.com/AlexeyAB/darknet/blob/master/scripts/voc_label.py](url)
> 
> And bigger Batch size may help.

Thanks very very much for your advice!
I have some doubt about 'split the train/test set'. I just use the default splitted train/val VOC datasets, do you mean that I have to re-split them by myself? 
I know that many papers use the VOC07trainval+VOC12trainval for training, which is much larger than the VOC07train+VOC12train (2501+5717 images) I used for traing. Could this be the reason that I can't reach the 0.8 mAP?
Besides, I do not use the burn-in strategy, multi-scale training and mosaic image loader. I don't know if these may help.
Hope my questions do not bother you.

> Besides, I do not use the burn-in strategy, multi-scale training and mosaic image loader. I don't know if these may help.
> Hope my questions do not bother you.

As the author of this repo said above, multi-scale training and mosaic image loader are active in default, and it is a great data augmentation to improve performance.

Besides, the way of splitting dataset actually matter a lot. When I split in my way, I also suffer from low mAP, nearly 0.6+. So that is a critical point.

Thanks very much for your help! Your suggestions are very helpful to me!

> Sure, I will try.
> For the 3rd question, there is a typo. I mean `multi-scale` actually.
> 
> Last time I ask you question, I only have 0.63mAP on VOC.
> Recently I have 0.835.
> Love your job.

Hi, I am training on voc2007 using this repository, but I only got around 72% mAP. How did you train to 83.5% mAP and any additional changes? You know, It's really exciting to get a high mAP.

> @winnerCR7 Generally, first you can add VOC 2012 into train set. If it is permitted, you can even add COCO into your train set and test on VOC2007test, due to overlapping classes.
> 
> Second, change default GIoU to CIoU (I find it is the best).
> 
> Third, add more train time data augmentation (I didn't try) and TTA.

So did you add voc2012trainval into train set to get 0.835? And I will try the second and third point. Have you changed other hyperparameters? Such as lr schedule, weight decay, momentum, etc.

1. I do mean that, and that is a general way to split the dataset

2. I did change hyps by evolve. But without enough GPU, I find it non-sense.

I get about 0.85 with YOLOv5m using the default training:
```bash
python train.py --batch 64 --cfg yolov5m.yaml --weights yolov5m.pt --data voc.yaml --epochs 50 --cache --img 512
```

> 1. I do mean that, and that is a general way to split the dataset
> 2. I did change hyps by evolve. But without enough GPU, I find it non-sense.

OK, I get and I will try. Thanks for your advice.

> I get about 0.85 with YOLOv5m using the default training:
> 
> ```shell
> python train.py --batch 64 --cfg yolov5m.yaml --weights yolov5m.pt --data voc.yaml --epochs 50 --cache --img 512
> ```

> 
> ```shell
> python train.py --batch 64 --cfg yolov5m.yaml --weights yolov5m.pt --data voc.yaml --epochs 50 --cache --img 512

so does this really work that use --cfg yolov5m.yaml --weights yolov5m.pt furthermore  is the v3 repo load and parse model same as v5 repo ?
